title: (((Emily Schrader)))
subtitle:

title: Umm 'Umar
subtitle: At first glance I thought it was snow on those hills when I drove pass. But it was in fact the refugees's tents. It's getting extremely cold by the day and living in a tent in this condition is very challenging. Please keep the Muslimeen in your 'aadiyah. pic.twitter.com/oHkWhSh7pD

title: Project ARTogether
subtitle:

title: UN Foundation
subtitle: From a remote town in Ethiopia to a refugee camp in Jordan, the @UN is putting #InnovationInAction to deliver scalable and sustainable solutions to achieve the #SDGs. title: SHIM
subtitle: Did you know the South Hills is home to the largest community of refugees in the Pittsburgh region? For more than a decade, SHIM has been providing comprehensive support to refugee and immigrant families who have resettled in the United States, helping them make a better life. pic.twitter.com/mhzcDNG3bQ

title: Stateless Dignity Project
subtitle:
This #GivingTuesday, we're aiming to raise $3000—enough to send 50+ #Rohingya #refugee #children to school through 2020. That's only $60 per student. Right now we're at $615—just over 20%. ...Can you help us keep their school open? #GiveDignity @ROHRIngya
https://www.statelessdignity.org/news/2019/12/1/give-the-gift-of-dignity-this-givingtuesday …pic.twitter.com/FTRN9fbMeJ

title: Jack Carr
subtitle: This Norman Rockwell painting graced the cover of The Saturday Evening Post in November of 1943. It’s a more somber scene than is usually represented in the Rockwell art we are accustomed to seeing. Titled “Thanksgiving: Girl Praying,” it is also called “Refugee Thanksgiving.” pic.twitter.com/nzJqqmUg8m

title: ImmigrationWatReg
subtitle: Meet Kathy Elliott, she is an exemplary resident who, along with her husband Tim, has been involved in helping refugees with affordable housing in #WatReg for many years by  keeping the cost of their unit low and renting it without a last month's rent deposit.  #DoingGreatThingspic.twitter.com/MDTpKBecbk

title: Butch Northwood
subtitle: Got to get going. It's rainy & chilly. We got the pickup loaded. Folks need these supplies now. In 20 minutes I will be in a third world nation of homeless refugees-victims of corporate greed, public apathy & corrupt politicians. America 2019. pic.twitter.com/SFKkJZohyd

title: Jennifer Chen
subtitle: Proud to present to the Committee on Community Services and speak on behalf of the ethnocultural communities. Budget cuts will have a huge impact on immigrants, refugees, and Indigenous people, their voices are the most needed to be heard. #Winnipeg #wpgpolipic.twitter.com/0aLBkn3okO
